#Text=Wikinews interviews peace activist Cindy Sheehan , 2014 California gubernatorial candidate
#Text=Thursday , August 8 , 2013
#Text=Cindy Sheehan in 2007 .
#Text=Image : dbking .

#Text=Peace activist Cindy Sheehan , who recently announced her intention to run as the Peace and Freedom Party 's nominee for governor of California in 2014 , took some time to answer five questions from Wikinews reporter William S. Saturn .
#Text=Sheehan is best known for her active opposition to the War in Iraq following the loss of her son Casey there in 2004 .

#Text=In protest of the war , she set up camp outside President George W. Bush 's ranch in Crawford , Texas , demanding a pullout of U.S. troops and prosecution of Bush administration officials for war crimes .

#Text=According to her website , Sheehan also advocates revolutionary socialism , believing it to be key to loosening the " Imperialist/Capitalist two-party stranglehold " on U.S. and world politics .

column1: #Text=This campaign is not Sheehan 's first foray into electoral politics .
#Text=In 2008 , she challenged then- House Speaker Nancy Pelosi for Congress , finishing second in a field of seven candidates .

#Text=During the campaign , she championed the reduction of U.S. troops abroad , and endorsed economic democracy , bank nationalization , single-payer health care , education subsidies , marijuana decriminalization , alternative fuels , and electoral reform .
#Text=In 2012 , she ran as the vice presidential nominee of the Peace and Freedom Party on a similar platform .
#Text=The party promotes socialism , feminism , and environmentalism .

#Text=Other gubernatorial candidates include Governor Jerry Brown of the Democratic Party , former Lieutenant Governor Abel Maldonado of the Republican Party , and 2012 Justice Party vice presidential nominee Luis J. Rodriguez of the Green Party .
#Text=With Wikinews , Sheehan discusses third party politics and her campaign and governing strategy , and assesses past governors of California , including Brown .
#Text=Interview
#Text=( ( William S. Saturn ) ) :
#Text=Understanding that third party candidates do not often win , what do you hope to achieve by running for governor of California ?
#Text=Cindy Sheehan :
#Text=First of all , unfortunately third party candidates NEVER win for high level state or federal offices , and now since Prop 14 passed , it is even harder .
#Text=Having said that , in 2008 , I ran as an independent against Nancy Pelosi and I came in second .

#Text=In California , I think I may have a good chance to advance to the general election and hopefully force the other candidate , ( Brown , ? ) to debate me and bring up the issues and solutions to more people .
#Text=( ( WSS ) )
#Text=How do you plan to spread your message throughout the state ?
#Text=Sheehan : We already have many Californians who have volunteered to host the campaign with fundraisers and town hall meetings .

#Text=I am going to ride my bike as much as possible to highlight the need to drastically cut our dependence on fossil fuels and to transition to clean , renewable , and sustainable forms of energy — also to highlight the need for cheap and comprehensive public transportation and infrastructure improvement .
#Text=( ( WSS ) )
#Text=How would you rate Jerry Brown 's performance as governor ?
#Text=What would you do differently than him ?
#Text=Sheehan :
#Text=Well , since I am challenging him , I would rate his performance as poor .
#Text=He is in the pockets of so many special interests , like oil and privatized prisons , that he is not looking out for the interests of everyone in this state .

#Text=I would hold dozens of town hall meetings to talk to the people of this state about their struggles and community-based solutions and work with the people to put their needs first and foremost .
#Text=Instead of destroying education , I would put a revival of our public school system as one of the most urgent things we need to do .
#Text=( ( WSS ) )
#Text=If elected , how would you work with a legislature hostile to your agenda ?
#Text=Sheehan : By getting the people involved in the process .
#Text=It ’s the only way we can do it .
#Text=( ( WSS ) )
#Text=Which past California governor do you most admire ?
#Text=Sheehan : I majored in US History at UCLA and was focusing on California history , so I admire someone who ran for governor , Upton Sinclair , more than anyone who actually was elected .
#Text=Our EPIC campaign is modeled off of his .
#Text=But if I had to pick one that was actually governor , I would say , populist-progressive Hiram Johnson .
#Text=May I also say that it ’s way past time that California elected a female ?
